author: m.kalinin
content:
The idea behind EL surfacing an error if it's not connected to CL is for users who used to look at EL logs and used to run EL clients before the merge. I think EL may stop surfacing and error when the Merge has happened, but I see the problem for while syncing.

> if it does not recieve a request on this endpoint at least once every 120 seconds.
It should rather be:
> if it does not recieve a request on this or any other `engine_` endpoint at least once every 120 seconds.

author: tersec
content: Yes, that would be a good change

author: tersec
content: There's separate motivation for that endpoint, to verify compatibility and allow for friendlier/more informative error messages by either or both of the CL or EL clients, but there's no reason for that to be every `n` seconds

author: tersec
content: just once is fine

author: tersec
content: Yes, websocket is much better supported by Nimbus. We do support http:// in theory, but there's some merge-unrelated crash (it happens in the usual `unstable` branch, not just the kiln branches): https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/issues/3521

author: tersec
content: not necessary exactly, but more robust, and right now, that's why the launchpad docs say to use ws:// and why my default response at this point to people encountering issues is, try websocket

We would like to deprecate both testnets on Thursday this week (24th March). Kintsugi relies on an older spec and is using older versions of most clients and we believe most scenario's we want to test wouldn't make sense there. Devnet5 also runs older versions of clients and is smaller in general. We'd like to move to a shadow forking approach for scenario tests so that we can have a state + load as well (More shadow forking info coming tomorrowðŸ˜‰ )

If anyone has arguments to be made for keeping either testnet alive, do let us know and we can reconsider. 

In the meantime, please migrate to the Kiln testnet. Resources can be found here: https://kiln.themerge.dev
